licenseExceptionText:
If you modify this Program, or any covered work, by linking or
combining it with runtime libraries of Erlang/OTP as released by
Ericsson on https://www.erlang.org (or a modified version of these
libraries), containing parts covered by the terms of the Erlang Public
License (https://www.erlang.org/EPLICENSE), the licensors of this
Program grant you additional permission to convey the resulting work
without the need to license the runtime libraries of Erlang/OTP under
the GNU Affero General Public License. Corresponding Source for a
non-source form of such a combination shall include the source code
for the parts of the runtime libraries of Erlang/OTP used as well as
that of the covered work.
name: Erlang/OTP Linking Exception
licenseComments: This exception is based on the suggested template from the Free Software Foundation's FAQ about the GPL.
licenseExceptionTemplate:
<<beginOptional>>Additional permission under GNU AGPL version 3 section 7

<<endOptional>>
If you modify this Program, or any covered work, by linking or combining it with runtime libraries of Erlang/OTP as released by Ericsson on https://www.erlang.org (or a modified version of these libraries), containing parts covered by the terms of the Erlang Public License (https://www.erlang.org/EPLICENSE), <<var;name="licensors";original="the licensors of this Program";match=".+">> grant you additional permission to convey the resulting work without the need to license the runtime libraries of Erlang/OTP under the <<var;name="libraryLicense2";original="[name of library's license]";match=".+">> . Corresponding Source for a non-source form of such a combination shall include the source code for the parts of the runtime libraries of Erlang/OTP used as well as that of the covered work.
exceptionTextHtml:
Additional permission under GNU AGPL version 3 section 7

If you modify this Program, or any covered work, by linking or combining it with runtime libraries of Erlang/OTP as released by Ericsson on https://www.erlang.org (or a modified version of these libraries), containing parts covered by the terms of the Erlang Public License (https://www.erlang.org/EPLICENSE), the licensors of this Program grant you additional permission to convey the resulting work without the need to license the runtime libraries of Erlang/OTP under the [name of library's license]. Corresponding Source for a non-source form of such a combination shall include the source code for the parts of the runtime libraries of Erlang/OTP used as well as that of the covered work.
